definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel

sentences.english: How , no study Chinese , open eye blind ?
sentences.chinese: 怎么样，不学中文睁眼瞎了吧？

sentences.english: Reflexology is also offered at Open Eyes of Life.
sentences.chinese: 按摩，也可享有睁眼生命。

sentences.english: He is busy to find, can just open eyes, soap will kill him in tears.
sentences.chinese: 他忙去找，可刚一睁眼，肥皂沫就杀得他直流眼泪。

sentences.english: Have client open eyes, and note blink reflex.
sentences.chinese: 嘱受检者睁眼，注重瞬目反射。

sentences.english: When Chou Chin awoke and saw where he was, he cried loudly and struck his head on the plate again.
sentences.chinese: 谁知周进睁眼看见号板，放声大哭，又一头撞去。

sentences.english: Do you also hope one goggle see a spring scenery is gorgeous?
sentences.chinese: 你也希望一睁眼就看到一片春光灿烂？

sentences.english: How many blind assumptions have youmade?
sentences.chinese: 你曾作出过多少睁眼瞎的假设呢？

sentences.english: Open right from wrong, close my eyes to calm thinking.
sentences.chinese: 睁眼明辨是非，闭眼冷静思考。

sentences.english: Day breaks. Everybody opens your eyes, please.
Now I even look forward to having bad dreams so I can wake up and see you.
sentences.chinese: 现在我甚至期待做噩梦，那样就可以一睁眼就看到你。

sentences.english: You seem to have a knack for underrestimating the exceptional.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎有本事睁眼说瞎话。

definition: to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
